item.title: A Supermarket Bag And a Truckload Of FOMO
item.description: The day was nearing to a close. The sun has already set, but that Friday evening in Amsterdam was still warm. Unusually warm, in fact, for those late days in March ‚Äì as if spring decided to bless my piligrimage, for that piligrimage was not jovial. I was sitting at a ramen joint, sipping on the broth. To my left, a blue, crinkled supermarket shopping bag was sitting solemnly, inconspicuously. Inside that bag sat a slightly used Mac Studio, which I have just purchased to be able to edit CSS of my own application. By the time that evening descended upon the south of Amsterdam, I have lost 3 days of my life trying to figure out why I was unable to edit CSS. But let me rewind a bit.

item.title: Two Years Building Workbrew, a Remote-First Enterprise Homebrew Startup
item.description: TL;DR: I left GitHub after 10 years to cofound Raise.dev. After an early failed experiment building IoT developer tools, we pivoted and built Workbrew: an enterprise-friendly layer over Homebrew, a project I‚Äôve maintained since 2009 and led since 2019. Two years in, we‚Äôve raised VC funding, built a remote team, and have happy, paying customers. Here‚Äôs what I learned so far.

item.title: Learn limitations of ReplacingMergeTree and Materialized Views for ClickHouse
item.description: ClickHouse‚Äôs ReplacingMergeTree and Materialized Views help handle JOINs and deduplication, but they have limitations at scale. Learn how they work, their performance trade-offs, and why they may not be enough for large datasets.

item.title: ".NET Will Not Exist in 10 Years"
item.description:
Check out Dometrain: https://dometrain.com Subscribe to my weekly newsletter: https://nickchapsas.com
Become a Patreon and get special perks: https://www.patreon.com/nickchapsas
Hello, everybody. I'm Nick, and in this video, I will talk about claims that .NET will not exist in 10 years and that it's old news. .NET is one of the coolest frameworks to work with so this is clearly an opinion of someone who has an agenda.
Workshops: https://bit.ly/nickworkshops
Don't forget to comment, like and subscribe :)
Social Media: Follow me on GitHub: https://github.com/Elfocrash Follow me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/nickchapsas Connect on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/nick-chapsas
#csharp #dotnet
item.author: (Nick Chapsas)

item.title: More LinkedIn "Tips": Dragging your whole database into memory!
item.description: LinkedIn is never short on performance tips on .NET - And this time we drag the whole database towards the client, twice!
